Package com.simulation

Class ArmyUnit

java.lang.Object
com.simulation.Unit
com.simulation.MovingUnit
com.simulation.ArmyUnit
class ArmyUnit
extends MovingUnit
ArmyUnit contains infantry and tanks, which have different parameters values such as maxHp, hp, maxAmmo, ammo, team.

  • Constructor Details

    • ArmyUnit

      public ArmyUnit​(int id, java.lang.String type, Map map, int movement, int team)
      constructor for ArmyUnit
      Parameters:
      id - id of unit
      type - type of unit
      map - map the unit will spawn on
      movement - max amount of fields that unit can move in one turn
      team - unit's team

    • getAlive

      public boolean getAlive()

    • takeSupplies

      void takeSupplies​(int hp, int ammo)
      take supplies from base or moving base

      if hp is bigger than max hp, then unit's hp will be set to max (same refers to ammo)

      Parameters:
      hp - - hp to be added
      ammo - - hp to be added

    • move

      void move​(Map map, UnitCreator uc)
      Allows ArmyUnit to move and interact with other Units. If the new searched field is free, the unit will take it. If it is not free, it will trigger different interactions based on type of unit that occupies the field.
      Specified by:
      move in class MovingUnit
      Parameters:
      map - map on which ArmyUnit will move
      uc - list of units

    • takeField

      private void takeField​(Field newField)
      allows Armyunit to occupy the field if it is free
      Parameters:
      newField - field that would get taken

    • attack

      private boolean attack​(ArmyUnit enemy)
      Allows ArmyUnit to attack other ArmyUnit. The attack will fail if any of units is already dead, the units are in the same team or unit has not enough ammo to attack.
      Parameters:
      enemy - ArmyUnit that will be attacked.
      Returns:
      if the attack was successful

    • takeHit

      void takeHit​(int damage)
      Lowers unit hp based on damage value or makes unit die if damage is sufficient.
      Parameters:
      damage - value subtracted from unit hp.

    • die

      private void die()
      sets the unit dead and sets the field free. Changes death stats.

    • resetArmyStats

      public static void resetArmyStats()
      resets the stats to start new simulation

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Unit
